title: Data and data governance for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: High-risk AI systems which make use of techniques involving the training of AI models with data shall be developed on the basis of training, validation and testing data sets that meet the quality criteria referred to in paragraphs 2 to 5 whenever such data sets are used.

legal_consequence.verbatim: High-risk AI systems which make use of techniques involving the training of AI models with data shall be developed on the basis of training, validation and testing data sets that meet the quality criteria referred to in paragraphs 2 to 5 whenever such data sets are used.

items.label: Data governance and management practices
items.text: Training, validation and testing data sets shall be subject to governance and management practices appropriate for the intended purpose (design choices, origin, processing, assumptions, suitability, bias assessment and mitigation, and gap identification).

items.label: Quality characteristics
items.text: Data sets shall be relevant, sufficiently representative, as error‑free and complete as possible, and have appropriate statistical properties (considering the intended purpose and setting).

items.label: Special categories of personal data (exceptional processing)
items.text: Processing special categories of data may occur strictly to detect and correct bias under appropriate safeguards and conditions, in addition to applicable data protection law.

items.label: Non‑training techniques
items.text: Where model training is not used, paragraphs 2–5 apply only to testing data sets.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for non‑compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).
